    • Method Detail

      • TPSFactories

        com.here.platform.location.core.mapmatching.javadsl.TransitionProbabilityStrategiesMixin.TPSFactories$ TPSFactories()

      • directDistance

        <O,V,E> TransitionProbabilityStrategy<O,V,java.util.List<V>> directDistance(DirectedGraph<V,E> graph,
                                                                            PropertyMap<V,java.lang.Double> length,
                                                                            RangeBasedPropertyMap<V,java.lang.Boolean> roadAccess,
                                                                            StraightLineDistanceCalculator distanceCalculator,
                                                                            GeoCoordinateAdapter<O> adapter)
        Creates a strategy using the distance between candidates to calculate transition probabilities given a specific graph and vertex lengths from a length PropertyMap.

        This strategy uses DirectDistanceCalculator to calculate the distance between points along the road network. DirectDistanceCalculator can only calculate distances between points on the same vertex or on two directly connected vertices. For that reason, this strategy should only be used when the expected distances between consecutive observations in a trip are small.

        See also DistanceTransitionProbabilityStrategy.

        Parameters:
        length - The lengths of the vertices of graph
        roadAccess - Ranges with value true are accessible, while ranges with value false will be interpreted as forbidden
        adapter - Adapter to extract latitude and longitude from O

      • directDistance

        <O extends GeoCoordinateHolder,V,E> TransitionProbabilityStrategy<O,V,java.util.List<V>> directDistance(DirectedGraph<V,E> graph,
                                                                                                        PropertyMap<V,java.lang.Double> length,
                                                                                                        RangeBasedPropertyMap<V,java.lang.Boolean> roadAccess,
                                                                                                        StraightLineDistanceCalculator distanceCalculator)
        Creates a strategy using the distance between candidates to calculate transition probabilities given a specific graph and vertex lengths from a length PropertyMap.

        This strategy uses DirectDistanceCalculator to calculate the distance between points along the road network. DirectDistanceCalculator can only calculate distances between points on the same vertex or on two directly connected vertices. For that reason, this strategy should only be used when the expected distances between consecutive observations in a trip are small.

        See also DistanceTransitionProbabilityStrategy.

        Use this overload of the method when the geographical coordinate type implements GeoCoordinateHolder.

        Parameters:
        length - The lengths of the vertices of graph
        roadAccess - Ranges with value true are accessible, while ranges with value false will be interpreted as forbidden

      • directDistanceImpl

        <O,V,E> TransitionProbabilityStrategy<O,V,java.util.List<V>> directDistanceImpl(DirectedGraph<V,E> graph,

                                                                                StraightLineDistanceCalculator distanceCalculator,
                                                                                GeoCoordinateOperations<O> evidence$1)

      • distanceWithTransitions

        <O,V,E> TransitionProbabilityStrategy<O,V,java.util.List<V>> distanceWithTransitions(DirectedGraph<V,E> graph,
                                                                                     PropertyMap<V,java.lang.Double> length,
                                                                                     RangeBasedPropertyMap<V,java.lang.Boolean> roadAccess,
                                                                                     StraightLineDistanceCalculator distanceCalculator,
                                                                                     GeoCoordinateAdapter<O> adapter)
        Deprecated. Use another overload of distanceWithTransitions instead. Since SDK 2.41.
        Creates a strategy using the distance between candidates to calculate transition probabilities. Note that even though the observations can be separated by multiple vertices, if they are not close enough, they will be considered unreachable.

        The computed paths will be returned by the HMMPathMatcher as MatchedPath.Transitions.

        See also DistanceTransitionProbabilityStrategy.

        Parameters:
        length - The lengths of the vertices of graph
        roadAccess - Ranges with value true are accessible, while ranges with value false will be interpreted as forbidden
        adapter - Adapter to extract latitude and longitude from O

      • distanceWithTransitions

        <O,V,E> TransitionProbabilityStrategy<O,V,java.util.List<V>> distanceWithTransitions(DirectedGraph<V,E> graph,
                                                                                     PropertyMap<V,LineStringHolder<GeoCoordinate>> geometry,
                                                                                     PropertyMap<V,java.lang.Double> length,
                                                                                     RangeBasedPropertyMap<V,java.lang.Boolean> roadAccess,
                                                                                     StraightLineDistanceCalculator distanceCalculator,
                                                                                     GeoCoordinateAdapter<O> adapter)
        Creates a strategy using the distance between candidates to calculate transition probabilities. Note that even though the observations can be separated by multiple vertices, if they are not close enough, they will be considered unreachable.

        The computed paths will be returned by the HMMPathMatcher as MatchedPath.Transitions.

        See also DistanceTransitionProbabilityStrategy.

        Parameters:
        length - The lengths of the vertices of graph
        geometry - Used to translate a path made of Vs to a line string (sequence of geocoordinates).
        roadAccess - Ranges with value true are accessible, while ranges with value false will be interpreted as forbidden
        adapter - Adapter to extract latitude and longitude from O

      • distanceWithTransitions

        <O extends GeoCoordinateHolder,V,E> TransitionProbabilityStrategy<O,V,java.util.List<V>> distanceWithTransitions(DirectedGraph<V,E> graph,
                                                                                                                 PropertyMap<V,java.lang.Double> length,
                                                                                                                 RangeBasedPropertyMap<V,java.lang.Boolean> roadAccess,
                                                                                                                 StraightLineDistanceCalculator distanceCalculator)
        Deprecated. Use another overload of distanceWithTransitions instead. Since SDK 2.41.
        Creates a strategy using the distance between candidates to calculate transition probabilities. Note that even though the observations can be separated by multiple vertices, if they are not close enough, they will be considered unreachable.

        The computed paths will be returned by the HMMPathMatcher as MatchedPath.Transitions.

        See also DistanceTransitionProbabilityStrategy.

        Use this overload of the method when the geographical coordinate type implements GeoCoordinateHolder.

        Parameters:
        length - The lengths of the vertices of graph
        roadAccess - Ranges with value true are accessible, while ranges with value false will be interpreted as forbidden

      • distanceWithTransitions

        Creates a strategy using the distance between candidates to calculate transition probabilities. Note that even though the observations can be separated by multiple vertices, if they are not close enough, they will be considered unreachable.

        The computed paths will be returned by the HMMPathMatcher as MatchedPath.Transitions.

        See also DistanceTransitionProbabilityStrategy.

        Use this overload of the method when the geographical coordinate type implements GeoCoordinateHolder.

        Parameters:
        geometry - Used to translate a path made of Vs to a line string (sequence of geocoordinates).
        length - The lengths of the vertices of graph
        roadAccess - Ranges with value true are accessible, while ranges with value false will be interpreted as forbidden
